newsitem.title: USA: Iraq said to buy 25,000-50,000 T U.S. wheat -trade.
newsitem.headline: Iraq said to buy 25,000-50,000 T U.S. wheat -trade.

text.p: Talk was widespread among U.S. exporters on Thursday morning that Iraq on Wednesday night bought 25,000 to 50,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat for April/May delivery.
"We are trying to get that clarified," one U.S. exporter said.
Exporters said they were unable to confirm the sale but they believed Iraq bought 25,000 to 50,000 tonnes.
But CBOT floor talk was that Iraq bought 75,000 tonnes of wheat from the U.S. at $187.00 to $190.00 per tonne, cost and freight.
One exporter had the price at $190 a tonne for the April position and $187 a tonne for the May position.
Iraq was tendering under the United Nations oil-for-food deal for 50,000 tonnes U.S. wheat for April/May shipment but a CBOT wheat trader said shipments may extend into June.
"Iraq bought U.S. hard wheat out of the Gulf," another wheat trader said. "The quantity was divided into 25,000 lots each."
The U.S. Department of Agriculture said Iraq last bought U.S. wheat during the 1989/90 crop year when it bought a yearly total of 1.3 million tonnes.
